2.text: “How long will you torment me, and crush me with words?

3.text: You have reproached me ten times. You aren’t ashamed that you attack me.

4.text: If it is true that I have erred, my error remains with myself.

5.text: If indeed you will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach;

6.text: know now that God has subverted me, and has surrounded me with his net.

7.text: “Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard. I cry for help, but there is no justice.

8.text: He has walled up my way so that I can’t pass, and has set darkness in my paths.

9.text: He has stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.

10.text: He has broken me down on every side, and I am gone. My hope he has plucked up like a tree.

11.text: He has also kindled his wrath against me. He counts me among his adversaries.

12.text: His troops come on together, build a siege ramp against me, and encamp around my tent.

13.text: “He has put my brothers far from me. My acquaintances are wholly estranged from me.

14.text: My relatives have gone away. My familiar friends have forgotten me.

15.text: Those who dwell in my house, and my maids, count me for a stranger. I am an alien in their sight.

16.text: I call to my servant, and he gives me no answer. I beg him with my mouth.

17.text: My breath is offensive to my wife. I am loathsome to the children of my own mother.

18.text: Even young children despise me. If I arise, they speak against me.

19.text: All my familiar friends abhor me. They whom I loved have turned against me.

20.text: My bones stick to my skin and to my flesh. I have escaped by the skin of my teeth.

21.text: “Have pity on me, have pity on me, you my friends; for the hand of God has touched me.

22.text: Why do you persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

23.text: “Oh that my words were now written! Oh that they were inscribed in a book!

24.text: That with an iron pen and lead they were engraved in the rock forever!

25.text: But as for me, I know that my Redeemer lives. In the end, he will stand upon the earth.

26.text: After my skin is destroyed, then in my flesh shall I see God,

27.text: Whom I, even I, shall see on my side. My eyes shall see, and not as a stranger. “My heart is consumed within me.

28.text: If you say, ‘How we will persecute him!’ because the root of the matter is found in me,

29.text: be afraid of the sword, for wrath brings the punishments of the sword, that you may know there is a judgment.”
